term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - disintegration energy, Q
term.title: disintegration energy

item.text: Energy liberated in a decay process and carried as kinetic energy of the emitted alpha or beta particle and the recoil energy of the product atom.

term.citation: Citation: 'disintegration energy' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.D01787

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
